content: > please note that the paid pdf is a > print-friendly written-only version of > the pattern and does not contain the > photo tutorial i designed the my voyage shawl for my 2019 australia/new zealand crochet cruise with crafty adventures it uses one of my favourite stitches the quiver fans stitch and has a pretty beaded make-as-you-go edging along one side once you have chosen your colourway the colour-change yarn makes it perfect for expressing your own style and journey without having to worry about which colour to use next to make this shawl you will need to know how to make the following stitches us * bp back post * chain - chain * double_crochet double_crochet * half_double_crochet half-double_crochet * single_crochet single_crochet * slip_stitch slip_stitch * treble_crochet treble_crochet the pattern is available for free on my website *us terminology* presented as a photo tutorial with a chart you can also buy the print-friendly us pdf in my ravelry store for a nominal fee i hope you enjoy this one and incorporate many of your own memories as you work on it dedri
